business.headline: Sensex closes 331 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; BEL down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 331.21 points to close at 84,900.71, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 108.65 points to end at 25,959.50.

GST 2.0 is lifting consumption. Can it lift Sensex and Nifty too?GST 2.0 has pushed prices down and demand up, but whether that momentum can lift Sensex and Nifty will depend on earnings, capex and global stability in the months ahead.

Tejas crash at Dubai Airshow isolated occurrence: Read HAL's full statementAn Indian Air Force Tejas fighter jet crashed in the United Arab Emirates on Friday while taking part in the Dubai Airshow 2025.

Who is Rama Raju Mantena, pharma king behind Udaipur's star-studded wedding?Rama Raju Mantena is a well-known name in the US pharmaceutical industry. Originally from Vijayawada in Andhra Pradesh, Mantena moved to the United States in the 1980s.
HAL share price falls 4% after Tejas fighter jet crash at Dubai AirshowThe HAL stock slipped to around Rs 4,430, down roughly 3.6% at 10:44 am. Earlier in the day, the stock had tumbled over 8%.

Excelsoft Technologies IPO allotment out: Did you get shares? Check listing detailsExcelsoft Technologies IPO allotment: Applicants who subscribed to the IPO can check their status through the BSE website or the registrar, MUFG Intime India Pvt Ltd.

Sensex, Nifty start week on a positive note as IT stocks lead the chargeBroader market indices were also in the green, mirroring the positive start. The tone was set by IT heavyweights: Tech Mahindra and Infosys jumped over 2% each, followed closely by gains in HCLTech and Wipro. Eicher Motors also featured among the early winners.

TCS suffers legal setback in US with $194 million penalty upheldThe matter has now been sent back to the Northern District of Texas, Dallas Division, which has been asked to review the injunction as per the directions of the Appeals Court.

Why billionaire Lakshmi Mittal is saying goodbye to the UKAs per the Forbes rich list, Mittal has a net worth of $21.4 billion. He is the 12th richest Indian and the 104th richest person in the world.

New labour codes: 10 key changes every employee should knowWhether someone works full-time, on a contract, or in sector-specific roles like media, plantations or factories, the new framework affects nearly everyone. Here are the key updates workers should be aware of, along with several other important changes that haven't received enough attention.

Feel cheated by your family will? Know your legal rightsWhether it is a sudden change in beneficiaries, unequal division of property, or doubts about the person's mental state when the will was written, such situations often create confusion, anger, and emotional stress.

Want to clear your home loan early? Simple ways to pay it off quicklyPay low EMIs and your tenure stretches, increasing your interest costs. Pay higher EMIs, and you could save years and lakhs on the total interest you pay.

New labour codes are here: Will your in-hand salary rise or fall?With the new labour codes now implemented, many employees are trying to understand what it means for their salary structure, especially basic salary, PF deductions and take-home pay.

New labour codes: What changes for paid leave, work hours and health benefitsThe new labour codes apply across sectors and are designed to improve safety, reduce fatigue and make workplaces more predictable for millions of workers in India.

Gratuity in a year? Only if you're a fixed-term employee. Here's what it meansOnly employees hired on fixed-term contracts qualify for the new one-year gratuity rule. Permanent staff remain under the five-year norm, making this benefit exclusive to India's expanding fixed-term workforce.

From gratuity to gig worker insurance: What new labour laws mean for employeesFrom gratuity to insurance and safer workplaces, the new rules expand what employees can expect from their jobs. Staying informed will help workers make the most of these changes.

Fixed-term employees to get gratuity after 1 year of service under new labour lawsAccording to the Union Labour Ministry, the restructuring is aimed at ensuring better wages, wider social security coverage and improved health-related protections for workers across sectors.

Sensex tumbles 400 points, Nifty ends above 26,000 amid volatile tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex fell more than 400 points to close at 85,231, while the NSE Nifty50 managed to stay above the 26,000 mark despite broad-based weakness across sectors.

Government implements four labour codes, replacing 29 old laws. Check detailsThe move brings together decades-old labour rules that were scattered across multiple legislations into a consolidated framework. Many of these older laws date back to the pre-Independence and early post-Independence era.

Rupee slides to record low of Rs 89.45 amid US-India trade uncertaintyThe outlook for the rupee remains uncertain as global risk sentiment stays fragile and investors wait for clearer signals from both the Fed and ongoing trade negotiations between Washington and New Delhi.

entertainment.headline: When Dharmendra dared the underworld: Entire Punjab village will fight your goons In an era when Bollywood bowed to the underworld, Dharmendra challenged the dons when he was threatened. He warned the gangsters that he had an army in Punjab that would come to fight them. He was called the He-Man for this raw courage and rugged charm in an industry that was seen too quick to cave in. Dharmendra passed away on Monday.

End of an era: Tracing cinematic journey of Bollywood's He-Man Dharmendra Dharmendra's death marks the end of an era in Bollywood. His versatile roles across the genres of romance, action and comedy have left a lasting legacy.

Dharmendra in last social media post to fans: May you be blessed with long life Legendary actor Dharmendra died at 89 in Mumbai after battling respiratory issues. His final Instagram post, a heartfelt Dussehra message, now feels like a farewell.

Good Bad Ugly director confirms second film with Ajith, shooting in February Director Adhik Ravichandran confirmed his second film with Ajith Kumar, with shooting likely to start in February. The pre-production work is almost complete.

Dharmendra cremated in Mumbai: Akshay Kumar, Sharmila Tagore pay emotional tribute Dharmendra died at the age of 89 years on Monday, November 24, 2025. Akshay Kumar, Farhan Akhtar, Sharmila Tagore, Kajol and others, paid their tributes.

Wanted him to celebrate his birthday: A teary Sharmila Tagore remembers Dharmendra Sharmila Tagore remembered Dharmendra with deep grief, recalling his generosity, warmth, and the protection he offered throughout their decades-long bond. She gave a heartfelt tribute to the legendary actor who died at 89.

Abhi na jao chhodkar…: Karan Johar's tearful goodbye to Dharmendra Karan Johar penned an emotional tribute to Dharmendra. Remembered as a "bonafide legend" and Bollywood's He-Man, the veteran star leaves behind an irreplaceable legacy.

120 Bahadur vs Mastii 4 box office: Farhan Akhtar's film surges ahead of sex comedy Two distinct Hindi films, 120 Bahadur and Mastii 4, opened on November 21, 2025. Their box office battle intensifies as new romantic dramas – 'Tere Ishk Mein' and 'Gustaakh Ishq' release next week.

Dharmendra, Bollywood's beloved He-Man, dies at 89 Dharmendra, the legendary He-Man of Bollywood, died at 89 in Mumbai. With a six-decade career, countless iconic films, and an enduring legacy, he leaves behind a void that Indian cinema can never fill.

Lena Dunham shares update on Too Much Season 2 Lena Dunham has stated that her romantic comedy series 'Too Much' will not return for another season, as it was always intended to be a limited series. Dunham shared her thoughts about the decision and reflected on the completed story.

Jana Nayagan hits Rs 100 crore before release, Tamil Nadu pre-sales at all-time high The Tamil Nadu theatrical rights for Vijay's much-anticipated film 'Jana Nayagan' have been acquired for an unprecedented Rs 105 crore, marking a historic high for regional film distribution and highlighting the actor's consistent market strength.

Ikkis: Dharmendra's poster from Agastya Nanda's war drama unveiled The poster of 'Ikkis' featuring veteran actor Dharmendra has been unveiled. Starring Agastya Nanda as Second Lieutenant Arun Khetarpal, the movie pays tribute to India's youngest Param Vir Chakra hero and is set to release on December 25.

Bigg Boss Tamil 9: Kemy eliminated, Vijay Sethupathi blasts Prajean, Divya Ganesh Bigg Boss Tamil 9 weekend episodes saw Kemy's eviction and Vijay Sethupathi's stern warnings to contestants. The host's fiery remarks exposed tensions, hinting at upcoming surprises in the show.

Shraddha Kapoor confirms her next with boyfriend Rahul Mody on hustle culture Shraddha Kapoor has confirmed she will star in a new film directed by Rahul Mody, focusing on the world of startups. Kapoor shared details about the project during a recent social media session with fans, highlighting her intention to take on more challenging roles.

Vikrant Massey kisses SRK's hands in moment of pure warmth at Mumbai event. Video A heartfelt moment between Shah Rukh Khan and Vikrant Massey at the Global Peace Honors 2025 has taken over social media, with the actors exchanging gestures of deep respect and warmth.

Wicked 2 actors Ariana Grande, Cynthia Erivo bid farewell to Glinda and Elphaba Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo have shared emotional farewells to their characters in 'Wicked: For Good' (2025). Their heartfelt posts and behind-the-scenes glimpses highlight the end of a memorable journey in the musical.

Jana Nayagan Malaysia launch: Andrea, Tippu to perform at Vijay's tribute concert Actor-singer Andrea Jeremiah and playback singers Tippu, Anuradha Sriram, and Saindhavi are set to perform at the audio launch of Vijay's film 'Jana Nayagan', scheduled for December 27 at Bukit Jalil Stadium in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.

Manoj Bajpayee says new generation well-prepared, weighs in on actor vs star debate Manoj Bajpayee praises the new generation of actors for their preparation and versatility. He shares his views on the blurred lines between actors and stars in today's industry.

Jeh stops paps from filming father Saif Ali Khan, internet can't get enough Saif Ali Khan's son Jeh surprised onlookers by shielding his father from paparazzi during a casual shopping trip. The moment quickly gained praise online.

general news.headline: Dharmendra, Bollywood's beloved He-Man, dies at 89Dharmendra, the legendary He-Man of Bollywood, died at 89 in Mumbai. With a six-decade career, countless iconic films, and an enduring legacy, he leaves behind a void that Indian cinema can never fill.

Arunachal China's part, Shanghai airport officials said: Indian alleges harassmentPrema Wangjom Thongdok, an Arunachal Pradesh–born woman, alleged that Chinese immigration officials at Shanghai Pudong Airport declared her Indian passport invalid, detained her for hours, and delayed her travel to Japan.

Shocking decision to continue: US pilot quits Dubai air show after Tejas crashWing Commander Namansh Syal died after his Tejas fighter jet crashed during a manoeuvre at the Dubai Airshow, prompting a US Air Force pilot to question why the event's flying schedule continued.

2nd Test Day 3 Live: Lead goes past 300 as India eye wicketsIndia vs South Africa live score 2nd Test Day 3 Updates: South Africa have extended the lead beyond 300 after bundling India out for 201 runs. Rickleton and Markram have made a steady start as Bumrah and Siraj are desperate to get wickets.

Wanted him to celebrate his birthday: A teary Sharmila Tagore remembers DharmendraSharmila Tagore remembered Dharmendra with deep grief, recalling his generosity, warmth, and the protection he offered throughout their decades-long bond. She gave a heartfelt tribute to the legendary actor who died at 89.
Updates: Dharmendra cremated in Mumbai, tributes pour inActor Dharmendra, Bollywood's beloved 'He-Man', died on November 24. The actor's last rites were at the Pawan Hans crematorium in Mumbai.

India isn't rushing into US trade deal. What's behind the confidence?A resilient domestic economy and a lower-than-expected hit on exports to the US is giving India the confidence to look Washington DC in the eye for a trade deal. On top of that, the inflation in the US forced the Trump administration to remove punitive tariffs on several products, which will benefit Indian exporters.

Afghan jet lands on Delhi airport runway meant for take-offs, probe launchedThe incident, which occurred on Sunday afternoon, has prompted aviation authorities to launch a probe over possible lapses in air traffic coordination.

When Dharmendra dared the underworld: Entire Punjab village will fight your goonsIn an era when Bollywood bowed to the underworld, Dharmendra challenged the dons when he was threatened. He warned the gangsters that he had an army in Punjab that would come to fight them. He was called the He-Man for this raw courage and rugged charm in an industry that was seen too quick to cave in. Dharmendra passed away on Monday.

Long live Hidma: Maoist posters, pepper spray at Delhi air pollution protestsOn Sunday evening, the protesters at India Gate tried to block traffic and allegedly pepper-sprayed police officers attempting to disperse them, leading to an FIR and a wider probe into how the Madvi Hidma posters surfaced at the demonstration.

Canada brings big changes to citizenship rules; India-born people to benefitCanada has taken a landmark step in modernising its citizenship laws that will benefit thousands of India-born Canadians. Bill C-3, which has received royal assent, allows naturalised citizens to pass on citizenship rights to foreign-born or adopted children.

Why billionaire Lakshmi Mittal is saying goodbye to the UKAs per the Forbes rich list, Mittal has a net worth of $21.4 billion. He is the 12th richest Indian and the 104th richest person in the world.

Rs 50-lakh film, 14,000% profit: Laalo - Krishna shakes up Gujarati cinemaGujarati blockbuster 'Laalo – Krishna Sada Sahaayate' continues its record-breaking run, racing toward the Rs 100 crore mark. The small-budget film has already delivered an unprecedented 14,000 per cent profit, rewriting box office history in Gujarat.
From Serenity to Celebration - Gujarat in All Its ShadesAnother destination that has stood the test of time and modernisation is Vadnagar.

Abhi na jao chhodkar…: Karan Johar's tearful goodbye to DharmendraKaran Johar penned an emotional tribute to Dharmendra. Remembered as a "bonafide legend" and Bollywood's He-Man, the veteran star leaves behind an irreplaceable legacy.
5 killed after bus falls into 70-metre-deep gorge in UttarakhandTill now, the State Disaster Control Force has rescued more than 20 passengers and has sent them to the nearby hospital.

India denied, but Mohsin Naqvi hands Pakistan Asia Cup trophyMohsin Naqvi handed the trophy to Pakistan A after they won the Rising Stars Asia Cup title after beating Bangladesh A in the thrilling final that went into the Super Over in Doha on Sunday. Naqvi, who is the Asian Cricket Council chief, famously denied India the Asia Cup after they beat Pakistan in the final earlier this year.

UP cyclist's miraculous escape caught on cam as speeding bus nearly runs him overThe cyclist, who was positioned just a few steps from the gate, spotted the out-of-control bus at the last second and leapt back, narrowly avoiding being crushed.

Depressed over US visa rejection, woman doctor dies by suicide in HyderabadAlthough the exact cause of death is yet unknown, the preliminary report suggests that the deceased either had an overdose of sleeping pills or injected herself on Friday night.

Supreme Court agrees to Rs 5,100 crore settlement by fugitive Sandesara brothersThe Supreme Court has agreed to drop all CBI, ED and PMLA cases against the fugitive Sandesara brothers in the Sterling Biotech fraud case.

Tejas crash: What is a negative-G manoeuvre, and why is it so risky?Fighter jets are primarily engineered to withstand high positive Gs encountered in combat turns and climbs. Negative Gs, however, can strain structural components, fuel systems, sensors, and avionics in different ways.

End of an era in Indian cinema: PM Modi's tribute to iconic actor DharmendraOn Monday, the 89-year-old veteran actor breathed his last after a long-standing battle related to respiratory issues. He was admitted to Mumbai's Breach Candy Hospital earlier this month and came home a few days back. Following his death, several politicians paid their tribute to the veteran actor.

The Family Man 4: Manoj Bajpayee assures all questions will finally be answeredThe third season of 'The Family Man', now streaming on Prime Video, surprised fans with a cliffhanger and the confirmation of a fourth season from lead actor Manoj Bajpayee.

Dharmendra: Bollywood's eternal hero who loved like poet, lived like legendVeteran actor Dharmendra, the legendary 'He-Man of Bollywood', enjoyed a six-decade legacy that defines heroism, love, and humility in Indian cinema. From 'Phool Aur Patthar' to 'Sholay' and 'Satyakam', his journey is one of grit and grace -- a life of both stardom and dreams.

Dharmendra dies days before his 90th birthdayLegendary actor Dharmendra died at 89 in Mumbai, today. The actor was admitted to the Breach Candy Hospital earlier this month. Bollywood's beloved He-Man leaves behind an extraordinary cinematic legacy of more than six decades. His last rites was attended by Amitabh Bachchan, Jaya Bachchahn, Salman Khan, Aamir Khan, Abhishek Bachchan, Akshay Kumar, Anil Kapoor and others.

End of an era: Tracing cinematic journey of Bollywood's He-Man DharmendraDharmendra's death marks the end of an era in Bollywood. His versatile roles across the genres of romance, action and comedy have left a lasting legacy.

sports.headline: Very ordinary batting: Ravi Shastri slams India batters after Guwahati collapse Former India coach Ravi Shastri criticised the team's "very ordinary" batting after a dramatic collapse on Day 3 of the Guwahati Test against South Africa, calling the performance a worrying reflection of India's muddled decision-making and unreliable Test batting strategy.

Karun Nair hints at frustration with cryptic post, amidst India's batting collapse As India's middle-order struggles against South Africa's bowling unit in the Guwahati Test, out-of-favour India batter, Karun Nair has shared a post on social media expressing his frustrations of not being out there with the team.

IND vs SA: Aiden Markram's superhuman flying catch leaves India in deep trouble Aiden Markram produced a breathtaking display of athleticism that left teammates in disbelief and sent social media into overdrive on the third day of the second Test at the Barsapara Cricket Stadium in Guwahati on Monday.

PM Modi praises India's blind women's team for historic T20 World Cup win Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday praised the Indian blind women's cricket team for scripting history with their title triumph at the inaugural Blind Women's T20 World Cup, calling the victory a testament to collective grit, discipline and the unwavering belief of a team that remained unbeaten throughout the tournament.

Can Rishabh Pant show responsibility? Stand-in captain blasted for his reckless shot Rishabh Pant faced heavy criticism after a reckless charge and edge led to his dismissal in the Guwahati Test. With India already under pressure, his shot selection and wasted review sparked an outpouring of anger on social media, raising fresh questions over his leadership and responsibility in the longest format.

Watch: Zohran Mamdani thrilled after special message from Arsenal great Ian Wright New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani was left overjoyed after receiving a surprise video message from Arsenal legend Ian Wright on Adam Friedland's show.

Sudharsan, Jurel slammed for Guwahati failures: Fans doubt if they are ready for Tests India's young batters Sai Sudharsan and Dhruv Jurel came under heavy criticism after poor first-innings dismissals in the Guwahati Test, with fans on social media arguing they are not yet ready for the demands of international cricket.

England coach Brendon McCullum urges fans to keep faith after Perth horror Coach Brendon McCullum appealed to England fans to "keep the faith", reaffirming that there would be no shift in strategy despite the team's humiliating defeat in the first Ashes Test in Perth.

IND vs SA: Anil Kumble explains why Sanju Samson deserved chance in India's ODI squad Anil Kumble believes Sanju Samson deserved a place in India's ODI squad for the South Africa series and warned that selectors may have mixed up T20 and ODI form when evaluating the wicketkeeper batter.

Watch: 40-year-old Cristiano Ronaldo scores stunning bicycle kick for Al Nassr Cristiano Ronaldo rolled back the years as he produced a stunning overhead kick to power Al Nassr to a commanding win over Al Khaleej. Al Nassr continued their fine run of form with another big win.

South Africa 1-0 India? Why a draw is likely in Guwahati Test Senuran Muthusamy and Marco Jansen have not just saved South Africa - they have slowed time in Guwahati. Their defiant stand has blunted India's attack, drained overs from the day, and kept the pitch looking flatter than ever. With the clock slipping away and neither side able to force a breakthrough, this Test now appears to be drifting toward an inevitable draw.

Sudharsan, Jurel slammed for Guwahati failures: Fans doubt if they are ready for Tests India's young batters Sai Sudharsan and Dhruv Jurel came under heavy criticism after poor first-innings dismissals in the Guwahati Test, with fans on social media arguing they are not yet ready for the demands of international cricket.

Watch: 40-year-old Cristiano Ronaldo scores stunning bicycle kick for Al Nassr Cristiano Ronaldo rolled back the years as he produced a stunning overhead kick to power Al Nassr to a commanding win over Al Khaleej. Al Nassr continued their fine run of form with another big win.

Their defiant stand has blunted India's attack, drained overs from the day, and kept the pitch looking flatter than ever. With the clock slipping away and neither side able to force a breakthrough, this Test now appears to be drifting toward an inevitable draw.

Lionel Messi powers Inter Miami to 1st East final, thrash Cincinnati in semisInter Miami progressed to their first-ever Eastern Conference final following a commanding 4–0 victory over FC Cincinnati. Lionel Messi led with one goal and three assists, while Tadeo Allende and Mateo Silvetti contributed crucial goals. Miami continues their historic playoff run and will next face either Philadelphia or NYCFC.

New Zealand's Kane Williamson returns for West Indies Tests, Jamieson restedKane Williamson has re-joined New Zealand for the three-Test series against the West Indies, with pacers Blair Tickner and Zak Foulkes included and Kyle Jamieson rested.

Eberechi adds an aura to Arsenal: Arteta praises hat-trick hero after Spurs winEberechi Eze provided the spark, swagger and "aura" Mikel Arteta insisted Arsenal needed, scoring the first hat-trick of his career to punish Tottenham and send the Gunners six points clear at the top of the Premier League.

From rock bottom to redemption: How Senuran Muthusamy revived his Test careerIND vs SA, 2nd Test: Senuran Muthusamy scored his maiden Test hundred in Guwahati, helping South Africa seize control of the match. The knock also marked a remarkable revival in his Test career, coming six years after he first debuted in 2019.

Ruturaj Gaikwad breaks selection barrier to force his way back into India teamAfter 16 months on the sidelines, Ruturaj Gaikwad has earned a return to the India squad for the ODI series against South Africa. The Maharashtra batter has kept piling on runs during his time away, and his prolific form has finally compelled the selectors to take notice.

2nd Test Day 3 Live: Lead goes past 300 as India eye wicketsIndia vs South Africa live score 2nd Test Day 3 Updates: South Africa have extended the lead beyond 300 after bundling India out for 201 runs. Rickleton and Markram have made a steady start as Bumrah and Siraj are desperate to get wickets.

Naqvi, who is the Asian Cricket Council chief, famously denied India the Asia Cup after they beat Pakistan in the final earlier this year.

Naqvi, who is the Asian Cricket Council chief, famously denied India the Asia Cup after they beat Pakistan in the final earlier this year.

Shastri's bold advice for India to win in Guwahati: Declare 100 behind if neededRavi Shastri has called on India to adopt a bold strategy in the Guwahati Test, suggesting a declaration even while trailing. India are trailing by 480 runs in the second innings after South Africa posted a massive score of 489.

India bowlers worked hard but South Africa's 489 is too many: Cheteshwar PujaraIND vs SA: Cheteshwar Pujara believes India's bowlers did their job early but let the game slip away. On a flat Guwahati pitch, South Africa's 489 has created a massive mountain for the hosts to climb.

KL Rahul to Captain India in ODIs vs South Africa | Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli in SquadThis special report covers the selection of KL Rahul as the captain for the Indian cricket team's upcoming ODI series against South Africa, starting November 29. The squad, announced by the Ajit Agarkar-led selection committee, includes senior players Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma. The report notes the committee 'opted to hand Rahul the captaincy even though Rohit Sharma was available to act as stand-in skipper'. Rahul's appointment comes as regular captain Shubman Gill was ruled out due to a neck injury sustained during a Test match. The team composition also sees pacers Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj being rested for the series, while all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has been brought in as a replacement for Akshar Patel.

R Ashwin tears into England's Bazball approach: How reckless can you be?Ravichandran Ashwin has criticised England's Bazball approach after their batting collapse in the first Ashes Test in Perth. Ashwin questioned whether high-risk batting is being wrongly justified as positive intent.

Clinical Pakistan hammer Zimbabwe to storm into T20I tri-series finalPAK vs ZIM: Pakistan stormed into the T20I tri-series final with a dominant 69-run win over Zimbabwe, powered by fifties from Sahibzada Farhan and Babar Azam, and Usman Tariq's hat-trick.

Usman Tariq rattles Zimbabwe, becomes 4th Pakistan bowler with Men's T20I hat-trickPAK vs ZIM: Usman Tariq etched his name into Pakistan's cricket history with a brilliant T20I hat-trick against Zimbabwe in Rawalpindi, becoming the country's fourth bowler to achieve the feat.

Real Madrid apologise to Elche's Andre Silva over Diogo Jota obituary confusionReal Madrid issued an apology after mistakenly using the wrong Andre Silva's image in a tribute video. The mix-up, made during a memorial segment, was quickly acknowledged and publicly corrected by the club.

Rishabh Pant faces scrutiny for Guwahati Test captaincy, Kuldeep Yadav defends skipperKuldeep Yadav has defended captain Rishabh Pant's field settings during the second Test against South Africa. Pant was criticised for his field placement and on-field tactics during South Africa's first innings.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
